hackathon-description-text: MinneHack is the largest hackathon in the region, hosted annually by ACM @ UMN since 2015. MinneHack is 24 hours, and always has great sponsors, a wide variety of submitted projects, and lots of great prizes and swag.
hackathon-rules: Participants must abide by the MLH Code of Conduct.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS
Best IoT Hack Using a Qualcomm Device

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=300-398 Washington Ave SE, Minneapolis, MN 55455, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: The project is innovative, creative, and original.
The presentation communicates in a clear and engaging way
The project is complete, thorough, and polished.
The project follows the main prompt, providing a relevant and useful solution to a problem related to sports injuries.

hackathon-location-address: 300-398 Washington Ave SE, Minneapolis, MN 55455, USA
hackathon-description-header: Create software that reduces the risks and costs of sports injuries.
hackathon-location-description: University of Minnesota, Twin Cities - Coffman Memorial Union Great Hall
